intro: Adenolinum alpinum, commonly known as the alpine adenolinum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb characterized by its compact growth habit and hairy, grayish-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Adenolinum alpinum is valued for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to high-altitude environments.
